issue.title: HLS loads the first chunk regardless of the bandwidth which makes it slow for the first load. How to fix that?
issue.body:
### What do you want to do with Hls.js?

If I set the browser to disable cache and keep the throttling level to slow 3G, then regardless of the bandwidth, hls.js tries to load the first chunk where it should've searched for the one which suites the client's bandwidth which it did after loading the first chunk. Is it the desired behavior or is there any flag to fix this? I'm trying this on: hlsjs.video-dev.org

This is the m3u8 file:
```
#EXTM3U
#EXT-X-VERSION:3
#EXT-X-INDEPENDENT-SEGMENTS
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:BANDWIDTH=7849677,AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH=4590691,CODECS="avc1.640028,mp4a.40.2",RESOLUTION=1280x720,FRAME-RATE=60.000
1072_pitstop_intro_2_1.m3u8
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:BANDWIDTH=6033446,AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH=3685777,CODECS="avc1.640020,mp4a.40.2",RESOLUTION=1280x720,FRAME-RATE=60.000
1072_pitstop_intro_2_2.m3u8
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:BANDWIDTH=3399040,AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH=2046127,CODECS="avc1.640020,mp4a.40.2",RESOLUTION=960x540,FRAME-RATE=60.000
1072_pitstop_intro_2_3.m3u8
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:BANDWIDTH=2535292,AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH=1498843,CODECS="avc1.640020,mp4a.40.2",RESOLUTION=960x540,FRAME-RATE=60.000
1072_pitstop_intro_2_4.m3u8
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:BANDWIDTH=1910681,AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH=1152869,CODECS="avc1.640020,mp4a.40.2",RESOLUTION=960x540,FRAME-RATE=60.000
1072_pitstop_intro_2_5.m3u8
#EXT-X-STREAM-INF:BANDWIDTH=1295545,AVERAGE-BANDWIDTH=791931,CODECS="avc1.64001f,mp4a.40.2",RESOLUTION=852x480,FRAME-RATE=30.000
1072_pitstop_intro_2_6.m3u8
```


![image](https://github.com/video-dev/hls.js/assets/140337092/eb5fe9f6-8670-4ef3-a385-c0e666cc9277)

### What have you tried so far?

_No response_

issue.title: ipone Xr and iPonh 12 mini issues

labels.name: Needs Triage
labels.description: If there is a suspected stream issue, apply this label to triage if it is something we should fix.

issue.body:
### What version of Hls.js are you using?

1.4.12.

### What browser (including version) are you using?

all

### What OS (including version) are you using?

mini - 14.6 , xr - 15.1

### Test stream

https://hlsjs.video-dev.org/demo/

### Configuration

```JavaScript
{
  "debug": true,
  "enableWorker": true,
  "lowLatencyMode": true,
  "backBufferLength": 90
}
```


### Additional player setup steps

_No response_

### Checklist

- [X] The issue observed is not already reported by searching on Github under https://github.com/video-dev/hls.js/issues
- [X] The issue occurs in the stable client (latest release) on https://hlsjs.video-dev.org/demo and not just on my page
- [X] The issue occurs in the latest client (main branch) on https://hlsjs-dev.video-dev.org/demo and not just on my page
- [X] The stream has correct Access-Control-Allow-Origin headers (CORS)
- [X] There are no network errors such as 404s in the browser console when trying to play the stream

### Steps to reproduce

1. ipone Xr or ipone 12 min all browser => https://hlsjs.video-dev.org/demo/
2. issue The player doesn't play


### Expected behaviour

The video in the player must load and play.

### What actually happened?

The video in the player doesn't load

### Console output

```shell
no console
```


### Chrome media internals output

_No response_

issue.title: Buffer hole on level switch

labels.name: Revisit-at-later-release-cycle
labels.description: Will revisit during release cycle indicated by the Milestone

issue.body:
### What version of Hls.js are you using?

1.4.7

### What browser (including version) are you using?

Chrome v114.0.5735.198 (Official Build) (arm64)

### What OS (including version) are you using?

MacOS

### Test stream

https://hlsjs.video-dev.org/demo/?src=https%3A%2F%2Fvz-ced6ec5f-c54.b-cdn.net%2F55d2cc15-6524-48f7-aa7f-677d41d17eb2%2Fplaylist.m3u8&demoConfig=eyJlbmFibGVTdHJlYW1pbmciOnRydWUsImF1dG9SZWNvdmVyRXJyb3IiOnRydWUsInN0b3BPblN0YWxsIjpmYWxzZSwiZHVtcGZNUDQiOmZhbHNlLCJsZXZlbENhcHBpbmciOi0xLCJsaW1pdE1ldHJpY3MiOi0xfQ==

### Configuration

```JavaScript
{
  "debug": true,
  "enableWorker": true,
  "lowLatencyMode": true,
  "backBufferLength": 90,
  "maxStarvationDelay": 4
}
```


### Additional player setup steps

_No response_

### Checklist

- [X] The issue observed is not already reported by searching on Github under https://github.com/video-dev/hls.js/issues
- [X] The issue occurs in the stable client (latest release) on https://hlsjs.video-dev.org/demo and not just on my page
- [X] The issue occurs in the latest client (main branch) on https://hlsjs-dev.video-dev.org/demo and not just on my page
- [X] The stream has correct Access-Control-Allow-Origin headers (CORS)
- [X] There are no network errors such as 404s in the browser console when trying to play the stream

### Steps to reproduce

1. Play the stream
2. Video freezes for few seconds when level is switched


### Expected behaviour

Video doesn't switch on resolution change

### What actually happened?

Problem occured only on Chrome. Safari and Firefox are not experiencing this issue.

There is a buffer hole for some reason that starts on 3.921333 second of the video and ends on 3.988
Buffer state:
Duration: 9.215999
Buffered: [0.021333, 3.921333] [3.988, 9.215999] 
Seekable: [0, 9.215999] 
Played: [0, 9.215999] 
Buffer for audio contains:[0, 9.215999] 
Buffer for video contains:[0.021333, 3.921333] [3.988, 9.187999] 
Dropped frames: 0
Corrupted frames: 0
TTFB Estimate: 5.000
Bandwidth Estimate: 32859297.994



### Console output

```shell
7.655 | Buffer stalled error
```


### Chrome media internals output

_No response_

forkee.name: hls.js
forkee.description: HLS.js is a JavaScript library that plays HLS in browsers with support for MSE.

issue.title: ManagedMediaSource Support

milestone.description:
Enhanced Codecs and Format support and selection
(HDR and multi-channel audio on supported platforms)

issue.body:
### This PR will...

1. Use ManagedMediaSource (MMS) when available rather than MediaSource for MSE based playback
    - Adds `preferManagedMediaSource` config option which defaults to `true`. Set to `false` to use standard `MediaSource` when available even if MMS is present.
1. Start and stop loading of media segments with MMS "startstreaming" and "endstreaming" events
    - Adds new new player API methods `pauseBuffering()` and `resumeBuffering()`
    (unlike `startLoad()` and `stopLoad()`, these methods do not interrupt Playlist loading)
1. Cap max quality based on MMS quality:
    1. low = ABR selection limited to 1280x720p max
    1. medium = 1920x1080p max
    1. (other) = no limit
1. Use HTMLSourceElements for MediaSource blob URL and set `media.disableRemotePlayback` to `true` to allow ManagedMediaSource to open (users can add additional source elements and allow remote playback as needed).
    - Setting `preferManagedMediaSource` to `false` prevents this behavior

### Why is this Pull Request needed?
Using ManagedMediaSource when available allows the User Agent to manage buffer levels and limit quality based on information not available to the page.

### Are there any points in the code the reviewer needs to double check?

ManagedMediaSource explainer: https://github.com/w3c/media-source/issues/320

issue.title: SSR broken in HLS 1.4.12 and Next 13

milestone.description:
Enhanced Codecs and Format support and selection
(HDR and multi-channel audio on supported platforms)

issue.body: ### What version of Hls.js are you using? 1.4.12 ### What browser (including version) are you using? Chrome Version 116.0.5845.140 (Official Build) (arm64) ### What OS (including version) are you using? Mac OS Ventura 13.4.1 ### Test stream https://github.com/jordizle/next-13-hls-1.4.12 ### Configuration ```JavaScript {} ``` ### Additional player setup steps _No response_ ### Checklist - [X] The issue observed is not already reported by searching on Github under https://github.com/video-dev/hls.js/issues - [X] The issue occurs in the stable client (latest release) on https://hlsjs.video-dev.org/demo and not just on my page - [X] The issue occurs in the latest client (main branch) on https://hlsjs-dev.video-dev.org/demo and not just on my page - [X] The stream has correct Access-Control-Allow-Origin headers (CORS) - [X] There are no network errors such as 404s in the browser console when trying to play the stream ### Steps to reproduce 1. clone `https://github.com/jordizle/next-13-hls-1.4.12` 2. `npm run dev` 3. Check console ### Expected behaviour No console errors. ### What actually happened? Console error ### Console output ```shell ⨯ node_modules/hls.js/dist/hls.mjs (397:0) @ enableLogs ⨯ ReferenceError: self is not defined at RootLayout (./app/layout.tsx:8:5) ``` ### Chrome media internals output _No response_

comment.body: Only merged commits and commits with a version tag are published to npm. If you could, please clone the branch or pr/number and npm link.
We want to use console in contexts where it is global regardless of whether self is.

issue.title: Issue with HLS.js PIPELINE_ERROR_DECODE and MEDIA_ELEMENT_ERROR

labels.name: Needs Triage
labels.description: If there is a suspected stream issue, apply this label to triage if it is something we should fix.

issue.body:
### What do you want to do with Hls.js?

I having an issue using the HLS.js video, we have this issue reproducing the video:


PIPELINE_ERROR_DECODE: Failed to send audio packet for decoding: {timestamp=120002666 duration=21333 size=634 is_key_frame=1 encrypted=0}

MEDIA_ELEMENT_ERROR: Format error

This is the URL https://b-vz-07e92f68-d33.tv.pandavideo.com.br/d79c35cc-d801-4107-adb9-261814fe1cda/playlist.m3u8

I don´t have any HLS.js config specifically, maybe you guys can have a suggestions for HLS to prevent any error/lag

### What have you tried so far?

_No response_

comment.body:
Actually, i think it's more a question/help to increase the stability of the video to try to find an error.

We have a Webinar Platform that receives a thousand users at the same time, and we use a good CDN to stream the video, but sometimes, the users complain that the video is crashing, slow, even if a good internet.

I would like to find a good configuration for that, the size of the video are 4GB, 5GB, duration of 1 hour and 30 minute.
